speaker: SHERIFF
line: Looks like nobody's home.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Oh, he's here. He knows the minute he steps out I'm changing the locks on him.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: He's an old guy, huh? I don't much enjoy evicting old folks.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: This particular one will change your way of thinking.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Mr. Skur? It's the sheriff. Will you open up, please?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Go ahead and open it up.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Ugh! God almighty! What the hell's he got in here?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Smells like a whole lot of something went bad. Mr. Skur? I'm armed. You're going to want to come out now.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: The bedroom's back that way.

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Mr. Skur?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: What is it?

speaker: SHERIFF
line: Ain't nothing but a glove. No reason to... oh, my god!

speaker: SKUR
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Arthur Dales?

speaker: DALES
line: Who's asking?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm a-a profiler with the behavioral sciences unit. You are Arthur Dales, former special agent with the Bureau? I need to ask you some questions about a man named Edward Skur. You opened a-a file on him in 1952.

speaker: DALES
line: I don't recall.

speaker: MULDER
line: I-I brought the case file here with me.

speaker: DALES
line: How long have you been in the bureau? Do you know what an X file is?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's, uh... it's an unsolved case.

speaker: DALES
line: No. it's a case that's been designated unsolved.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Dales, most of your report has been censored... as you can see. Now, if somebody's trying to bury this case. I'd like to know why. According to your report, Edward Skur disappeared 38 years ago, before you had a chance to arrest him for a series of stranger killings in which the victims' internal organs had all been removed.

speaker: DALES
line: And now you've found him?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. last week. Shot to death by a sheriff serving an eviction notice. A man was also found in his bathroom with all his soft tissue removed.

speaker: DALES
line: Well, if he's dead there's nothing you need from me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir, sir, m-my name is Mulder. You know that name... and so did Edward Skur. How?

speaker: DALES
line: Have you ever heard of HUAC, Agent Mulder--the House Un-American Activities Committee? No, no, no, it was before your time. You wouldn't know. They hunted communists in America in the '40s and '50s. They found... practically nothing. Do you think they would have found nothing unless nothing... was what they wanted to find? Hmm?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh... I'm sorry, sir. I-I, uh... I don't, I don't see the connection.

speaker: DALES
line: Maybe you're not supposed to.

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: The nation's chief red hunters, senator Joseph McCarthy and FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover, join forces. Working through congress, the senator from Wisconsin and the legendary lawman, vow to wipe out the red menace within our own federal government. Roy Cohn, chief counsel at the McCarthy hearings, warns communist mind control can strike anywhere, at any time. It is those Americans sympathetic to the communist cause-- the so-called "fellow travelers"--who pose the greatest threat to our national security. "…Gissing … Edward Skur or Terrill Oberman" MULDER looks at old card for the Communist Party bearing SKUR’s name, address, Leesburg VA, 11-5-47, signed by "W. Schneidermann." RING shot #3.)

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: So says the young U.S. attorney--and he should know. It was Mr. Cohn that brought those atomic spies, the Rosenbergs, to justice. It was his staunch defense of the American way of life, that first brought Roy Cohn to the attention of senator McCarthy. With the support of the FBI, Mr. Cohn and Mr. McCarthy vow to work tirelessly to root out the more than 70 suspected communist spies, and the untold numbers of fellow travelers working in our own state department.

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: ...tirelessly to root out the more than 70 suspected communist spies and the untold numbers of fellow travelers working in our own state...

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: ...and the untold numbers of fellow travelers working in our own state...

speaker: MULDER
line: Dad.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good morning, Mr. Dales. I brought you some coffee.

speaker: DALES
line: Speak.

speaker: MULDER
line: Edward Skur died saying a name--my name. My father's name.

speaker: DALES
line: Go ask your father.

speaker: MULDER
line: My father and I don't really speak.

speaker: DALES
line: I told you I can't help you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Dales, I want the truth, and I will subpoena you to get it, if I have to.

speaker: DALES
line: Before his disappearance, Skur worked for the state department, just like your old man did. You had to have suspected the connection before you came here yesterday, but you said nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man that Edward Skur killed 38 years ago--was my father involved?

speaker: MULDER
line: How?

speaker: DALES
line: Skur killed this man the way he did all the others. All the soft tissue, internal organs, ligature--all were removed... without tearing the skin.

speaker: MULDER
line: The coroner wasn't able to determine how.

speaker: DALES
line: Oh, I can tell you... how. What I can't tell you... is why.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said in your report that uh, Skur was suspected of being a communist?

speaker: DALES
line: Well, that's what they said he was. That's what they said they all were.

speaker: DALES
line: To us, Skur was just another name on a list, another commie spy at the state department. We had no idea who--or what-- Edward Skur really was.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: May I help you?

speaker: DALES
line: My name's Arthur Dales, ma'am. I'm with the Federal Bureau of Investigation. This is my partner, Agent Michel. Is your husband in?

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: What do you want with him?

speaker: SKUR
line: Supper's getting cold, sweetheart. I'll take care of this. It's all right.

speaker: DALES
line: Edward Skur?

speaker: SKUR
line: Yes.

speaker: MICHEL
line: You're under arrest for contempt of Congress--failure to appear before the committee.

speaker: SKUR
line: I'm a family man, for God's sake!

speaker: MICHEL
line: You should have thought of that before you decided to betray your country, Red.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: Edward?

speaker: DALES
line: Let's go.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Look what I found.

speaker: SKUR
line: You planted that.

speaker: MICHEL
line: I'll plant one in your keister, Bolshevik, you don't watch your mouth.

speaker: DALES
line: I'm sorry. I...

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: Get out.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: Geez, Louise, what did you do--take a swim in the Potomac?

speaker: DALES
line: I'd probably be drier if I had. Got something to warm me up?

speaker: BARTENDER
line: Where's your partner?

speaker: DALES
line: He's processing a prisoner.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: You guys, uh, still busting reds?

speaker: DALES
line: Till Mr. Hoover tells us different.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: Good for you, Mr. Dales.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: Yeah? Mr. Dales? For you.

speaker: DALES
line: Yeah?

speaker: MICHEL
line: You try to reach me?

speaker: DALES
line: No, why?

speaker: MICHEL
line: I thought maybe you heard about Skur.

speaker: DALES
line: What about him?

speaker: MICHEL
line: He's dead. He hung himself in his cell. The guards found him about 20 minutes ago. You figure commie central command tells these mopes to snuff themselves in the event of capture?

speaker: DALES
line: I got to go.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: Everything okay?

speaker: DALES
line: Oh, nothing a little bourbon won't cure.

speaker: 1990 DALES
line: I didn't know what I should say to her. "I'm sorry about your loss, Mrs. Skur. If there's anything I can do..." The words sounded hollow. No matter what I said, I was the man who'd busted her husband--turned her life upside down. I sat there for over an hour trying to find my courage in a bottle. And then, and then I saw someone I shouldn't—I-I couldn't--have seen. Now it was my life that would be turned upside down.

speaker: DALES
line: Edward Skur!

speaker: NEIGHBOR MAN
line: Hey! who's down there?!

speaker: 1950’S TV
line: Dateline, Washington--the Justice Department vows no mercy for A-bomb spies. Julius and Ethel Rosenberg once again manage to delay their date with the electric chair. Prosecutors say they are confident Judge Kaufman's death sentence will be upheld by the highest court in the land.

speaker: 1990 DALES
line: The world still seemed clear to me that morning. Despite what I'd seen the night before, I still thought I knew who the bad guys and the good guys were. But that was all about to change.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Hang up.

speaker: DALES
line: Let me call you back.

speaker: MICHEL
line: What did the watch commander say?

speaker: DALES
line: They're going door-to-door in the neighborhood. There's no sign of him yet.

speaker: MICHEL
line: They're not going to find him, Artie. Open it up.

speaker: DALES
line: Skur...

speaker: MICHEL
line: Maybe you want to change your description of the suspect who assaulted you.

speaker: DALES
line: When were these taken?

speaker: MICHEL
line: Last night. Two hours before you say Skur attacked you. You had a few. You were feeling bad about what happened. It's understandable.

speaker: DALES
line: I... I didn't have that much to drink.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Just leave Skur's name out of your report. Nobody else has to know.

speaker: DALES
line: I already filed my report. An hour ago.

speaker: MAN
line: Dales. Call for you.

speaker: DALES
line: Yes. I'll be right there. it's the Justice Department. They want to talk to me.

speaker: COHN
line: Agent Dales, have a seat. You know who I am?

speaker: DALES
line: You prosecuted the Rosenbergs. Now you're working with Mr. Hoover and, uh, Senator McCarthy.

speaker: COHN
line: Then you know how important my work is--how vital it is to the future of this country that these rats, these vermin, who dare call themselves Americans be exposed as the traitors they are.

speaker: DALES
line: I don't interest myself in politics, Mr. Cohn.

speaker: COHN
line: Everything is political, Agent Dales. Like this report you filed this morning. We've spoken to Mrs. Skur and the neighbors. You seem to be the only person who can identify that man as Edward Skur.

speaker: DALES
line: Do you believe me, then?

speaker: COHN
line: We are fighting a powerful enemy in a war of ideology. In any war there are secrets--truths that must be kept from the public in order to serve the greater good.

speaker: DALES
line: You want me to amend my report? Take out any reference to Edward Skur? I don't understand...

speaker: COHN
line: You're not supposed to understand. You're supposed to follow orders.

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: Agent Dales?

speaker: DALES
line: Yeah.

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: I pulled that file.

speaker: DALES
line: Oh, right. Thank you.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Dales.

speaker: 1990 DALES
line: I'd never so much as faked an expense report or used a Bureau car to drive home, so lying didn't sit well with me, even if I was under orders. I wanted to leave behind the business of Edward Skur and never hear that name again. But it was too late. By then, Skur had already become a murderer.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Homicide call came in from Chevy Chase PD. Advise and assist.

speaker: DALES
line: Well, where are they?

speaker: MICHEL
line: Must have come and gone.

speaker: DALES
line: I know this song. They were playing it the day my unit rolled into Berlin.

speaker: MICHEL
line: The guy must be a Kraut.

speaker: DALES
line: Yeah. Well-connected Kraut.

speaker: MICHEL
line: There you go. I got six ounces of German shrapnel in my can and this Kraut got to shake hands with the president?

speaker: DALES
line: What's that? You smell that?

speaker: MICHEL
line: Yeah. Kinda. Hospital smell. Formaldehyde, maybe?

speaker: MICHEL
line: Well-connected dead Kraut.

speaker: DALES
line: What the hell happened to him?

speaker: OFFICER 1
line: Hands in the air! Over there! Come on! Now!

speaker: DALES
line: Whoa, fellas, FBI.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Credentials in my front coat pocket. Hey, easy on the material. I'm Agent Michel. This is my partner, Agent Dales.

speaker: OFFICER 1
line: Who called you guys out here?

speaker: MICHEL
line: You did, you mope. We got the call from your department.

speaker: OFFICER 2
line: We don't know nothing about that.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Then who brought you guys out here?

speaker: OFFICER 1
line: One of his nurses called in. Said the doc didn't show up for surgery this morning.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Something tells me he ain't going to make it.

speaker: 1990 DALES
line: : I was summoned to the bar by a man who'd already been to the doctor's house that morning. It was the man, Agent Mulder, you came here to ask me about.

speaker: DALES
line: Skur?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: No. But I came here to warn you about him.

speaker: DALES
line: Like you warned that doctor you murdered in Chevy Chase?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: I tried to save that man, but I was too late.

speaker: DALES
line: Skur killed him?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: He'll kill you, too.

speaker: MICHEL
line: : Myrtle?

speaker: DALES
line: What are you talking about? what is this, some kind of communist plot?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: Skur's not a communist. He's a patriot. All of these men are patriots.

speaker: DALES
line: What are you talking about? What men?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: There were three men--veterans--working at the State Department. Skur, Gissing and Oberman.

speaker: DALES
line: Gissing and Oberman. I read those names on a censored report.

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: They're dead now.

speaker: DALES
line: Murdered?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: No. Dead by their own hand. They couldn't live with what they'd become--what they'd been turned into--and Skur's the last.

speaker: DALES
line: Why did they put out that story about him hanging himself?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: Because they had to do something to cover up what they'd done to him. Label him a communist--say he killed himself and put him up someplace where no one's going to look for him. But his escape threatens everything.

speaker: DALES
line: Threatens what? What did they do to him? Look... you asked me here.

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: And I risked my career and my family by coming here. But the crimes these men have committed against innocent people... I can't have that on my conscience anymore. Someone needs to know the truth.

speaker: DALES
line: Who are you?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: My name is Mulder. I work at the State Department.

speaker: MICHEL
line: Mmm... attaboy, tail gunner. Give 'em hell. Ah, Myrtle. Dumb cat. Damn it! Damn it, Myrtle!

speaker: DALES
line: All right, then, Mr. Mulder. Who is this "they" you want me to arrest?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: You can't arrest these men.

speaker: DALES
line: Why not?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: It's... political.

speaker: DALES
line: What are you telling me? Are you telling me that Mr. Cohn and Senator McCarthy are involved in this? Is Skur after them, too?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: Skur wants vengeance for what those men did to him. He's a killer now. He can only guess at the dimensions of this conspiracy. But he thinks you're part of it. You and your partner.

speaker: DALES
line: Your phone.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: What's the number?

speaker: DALES
line: Klondike 5-0133.

speaker: MICHEL
line: I knew I should have got a dog.

speaker: DALES
line: Come on. Come on.

speaker: CORONER
line: Are you, um... are you sure a man did this? Uh, I suppose, um, he could have force-fed him a... corrosive agent of some kind, an acid maybe...except I-I don't know why it wouldn't have, uh, burned to the skin.

speaker: DALES
line: That account for the smell?

speaker: CORONER
line: Maybe. We won't know for sure until we get a toxology report. Hopefully, we'll have an answer for you in six to eight weeks. Meanwhile, we can, uh, at least start on a physical exam of the body... Such as it is.

speaker: COHN
line: Agent Dales... Hey, hey, where do you think you're taking that? This man's a veteran. The body goes to Bethesda. Howard, take care of this.

speaker: DALES
line: Mr. Cohn, these men are going to the county morgue. An autopsy needs to be performed.

speaker: COHN
line: Come here. Give us a minute. You wanna to test me--see how fast I can pull the chain and flush you. You want to see your name on a list? Are you now, or have you ever been...?

speaker: DALES
line: What are you talking about? I'm no communist.

speaker: COHN
line: You are, if I say you are. This is a matter of national security. Take this body out of here. Get it out. See? You're a patriot again.

speaker: DALES
line: When your partner dies, a piece of you dies with him. I'd been threatened by Mr. Cohn, but I couldn't leave it alone... Not while Michel's killer was still out there... Not if I wanted to live with myself. I knew Skur had killed Michel out of vengeance for what had been done to him--your father had told me as much--but your father also said there were two other men who'd had the same thing done to them... Men who were already dead. Finding out what happened to them, at least might help me understand what Skur had become... understand how my partner was killed.

speaker: DALES
line: What is this?

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: The deposition that names Edward Skur and these other two men as communists.

speaker: DALES
line: It's all censored.

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: By the committee, to protect the identity of the witness.

speaker: DALES
line: There was no witness. This whole thing's been manufactured. Edward Skur is no communist. Neither are these other two men, Gissing and Oberman. I wanna see their files, Gissing and Oberman.

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: I already checked. They're missing but I recognize one of these names. It's in an X-file.

speaker: DALES
line: An "X-file"?

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: Yes, unsolved cases. I file them under "x."

speaker: DALES
line: Why don't you file them under "u" for "unsolved"?

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: That's what I did until I ran out of room. Plenty of room in the "X"s.

speaker: DALES
line: Who decides when a case gets an "X"?

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: The director's office. It's, uh... it's kind of a dead end. No one's supposed to see them, but it makes for interesting reading. Here it is. A German emigre, Dr. Strohman patriated here after the war. He was found dead in his office last week at the VA.

speaker: DALES
line: Let me guess. They weren't able to explain how. His body just kind of collapsed, right?

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: Yes.

speaker: DALES
line: Gissing? His name's in this file, somewhere?

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: Yes. He was a patient. Found dead on the scene. Suicide. I guess he didn't much care for his treatment.

speaker: DALES
line: They think he killed his doctor and then killed himself? How did Gissing kill this man?

speaker: BAHNSEN
line: That's why it's an X-file. They don't know.

speaker: CORONER
line: You're lucky Gissing's body's still here. The VA's been trying to have it transferred.

speaker: DALES
line: Why haven't they?

speaker: CORONER
line: Well, this fella's a bigwig in the State Department. His family's been kicking up a stink.

speaker: DALES
line: What is this?

speaker: CORONER
line: Well, looks like he had some surgery. Judging by the color of the scar, I'd say it was fairly recent.

speaker: DALES
line: I want you to cut this man open.

speaker: CORONER
line: No, I-I can't do that. His family will have my head.

speaker: DALES
line: Gissing and a man named Skur were patients of the same doctors. I think whatever was done to this man was also done to the man who killed my partner. It may be the only way we have to explain how he died.

speaker: DALES
line: What's that? What is that?

speaker: CORONER
line: I don't know. It, uh... looks like it's lodged into his esophagus. Wait a minute. Those are sutures. Whatever this is, someone put it there. Oh, geez. Whoa.

speaker: CORONER
line: Oh... Oh, my god.

speaker: DALES
line: Mrs. Skur, I hope I'm not disturbing you.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: You have a lot of nerve coming here.

speaker: DALES
line: Your husband... You know he's not dead.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: How dare you?

speaker: DALES
line: Your husband was discredited in order to cover up a crime. Mrs. Skur--a crime that was committed upon him, against his will.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: Whatever was done to my husband, you're part of it.

speaker: DALES
line: According to VA Records, your husband underwent surgery for war injuries. So did two other men that he worked with at the state department, but the surgeries that they received... It wasn't what they thought it was. It had nothing to do with their war injuries.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: Then what was it?

speaker: DALES
line: It's called xenotransplantation. It's, uh, the grafting of another species into the human body. It's a procedure that nazi doctors experimented with during the war, and I believe that they continued their work here, using your husband and these other two men as unwitting test subjects. I want to expose what was done to your husband, Mrs. Skur. I can't do that unless I have his help.

speaker: COHN
line: Get in. Just get in.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: Ed? Oh, god. Are you all right?

speaker: SKUR
line: I told you not to come down here.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: That FBI Agent came back.

speaker: SKUR
line: I'm getting worse.

speaker: MRS SKUR
line: He says he wants to help you.

speaker: SKUR
line: It's too late to help me. I can't help myself anymore.

speaker: COHN
line: You sit there.

speaker: HOOVER
line: Leave us alone.

speaker: COHN
line: Mr. Director...

speaker: HOOVER
line: Leave us. In 1945, at the time of the first conference to map out the peace, after the second world war, there lived within the Soviet orbit 180 million people. Lined up on the anti-totalitarian side at that time were one billion, 625 million people. Today, Mr. Dales, just seven years later, there are 800 million people under the absolute domination of Soviet Russia--an increase of over 400 percent. On our side the figure has shrunk to around 500 million. In other words... in less than seven years the odds have changed from nine to one in our favor, to eight to five against us. The threat of global communist domination is a reality that can be ignored only at the risk of our own annihilation.

speaker: DALES
line: The men we arrested weren't communists.

speaker: HOOVER
line: If we are to defeat the enemy, we must use their tools. We must go further. We must do those things which even our enemies would be ashamed to do. It is only through strength that we can make our enemies fear us, and thereby ensure our own survival. You have one chance, Mr. Dales, to save yourself--to demonstrate that you have the strength to serve your country.

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: Make your meeting with Skur. Let him think you're alone. Put him at ease. We'll be in when the time is right.

speaker: DALES
line: Is this why you came to see me, Mr. Mulder? Make me your stalking horse?

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: I follow my orders.

speaker: DALES
line: I might need that.

speaker: BILL MULDER
line: We want him alive.

speaker: DALES
line: Here you go.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: I turned the lights off out front. Just pull the door shut when you go.

speaker: DALES
line: Thanks for your help.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: Anything to help out the Bureau.

speaker: SKUR
line: Did you come here to kill me or save me?

speaker: DALES
line: I'm here to help you, just like I told your wife.

speaker: SKUR
line: My wife is dead. I'm dead, too, inside, because of this thing they put in me. For what? To turn me into some kind of killing machine, or just to see what would happen? They're not coming, you know. They wanted me to kill you, or you wouldn't be here. You're part of their test now, too.

speaker: DALES
line: I don't want to kill you.

speaker: SKUR
line: I know.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't believe my father threw in with these men. He let them dictate his conscience.

speaker: DALES
line: Oh, don't fool yourself. None of us are free to choose. I was ruined for my insubordination. You keep digging through the...The X-files and they'll bury you, too.

speaker: MULDER
line: Skur died saying my father's name. Why?

speaker: DALES
line: I haven't the faintest idea.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, there was, um... there was one thing you didn't explain. It was, uh... how Skur was able to get away... how he was able to live in obscurity for the last 38 years.

speaker: DALES
line: 38 years? My God. Well, I kept hearing things through the years, you know. Uh, people tell me things. I heard that he was dead-- that he'd been kept in some secret lab while they finished up the, uh, experiment. I even thought that maybe... maybe some poor innocent bastard--somebody with a conscience--might have let him go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why would anyone do that? Why let a killer go free?

speaker: DALES
line: In the hope that by letting him live, the truth of the crimes that were committed against him and the others might someday... be exposed.
